summary: Email chain between defense attorney Marc Fernich and a prosecutor regarding the coordination of returning personal items (cash, phone) seized from Jeffrey Epstein upon his arrest, and the government's retention of electronic devices as evidence. The emails also reference the filing of a government bail memorandum.

Both are defense attorneys working on the Epstein case, as indicated by being copied on emails.
Fernich (defense) and the AUSA (prosecution) are corresponding regarding evidence and bail in the criminal case.
Weinberg is co-counsel for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Government Bail Memorandum Filed
events.description: The government files a memorandum on the issue of detention/bail in the case U.S. v. Epstein, sent to the chambers of Judges Pitman and Berman.

events.title: Coordination for Return of Seized Items
events.description: Email chain between defense and prosecution regarding arranging pickup of cash and personal effects seized from Epstein at arrest, while electronic devices are retained as evidence under a warrant.

locations: Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the case)
Boston (mentioned as location Marty Weinberg is returning to)
keyFacts: Personal items (cash, phone, other effects) were seized from Jeffrey Epstein upon his arrest, and his defense team sought their return.
The government obtained a warrant to search Epstein's electronic devices and was retaining them as evidence.
The case is U.S. v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), and involved a bail/detention hearing.
The email chain shows coordination between defense attorney Marc Fernich and prosecutors regarding evidence handling shortly after Epstein's arrest.
